author: Cafe Kafe

text:
When I played through this game, one thought continually struck me: It seemed really low budget. The game reused music tracks continually, not to mention the stock sound effects for the battles. The cutscenes also felt like the bare minimum, and I always wondered why that was.
Then I made it to the ending and discovered where all the money went. It was so beautiful.

text: Where is this beautiful music in game?

Omg.... I was so sag when I finished this game.... I still can not decide which PS1 game was better. Wild Arms, Grandia 1 or FF 7 / 8 / 9...
I think Wild Arms will stay in my memories for a very long time.
It wasn't only some good game, it was a present from my brother, who is 11 years older than me. He moved away 1 year before he gave me this.
Great game, great memories... Thanks Supra =)
